lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ghbot.GhBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ghbot.GhBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + deadline + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + this.taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param lstNo The index of the task that is going to be removed.
* Returns a string to let user know that the task has been removed.
* @return A string to let user know that the task has been removed.
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();
this.executeStr = "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + this.taskList.getTask(lstNo - 1) + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + this.taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param description A description of the event.

* @param toTime The end time of the event.

Event event = new Event(this.description, this.fromTime, this.toTime);
this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + event + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + this.taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* Sets an instance of task list.

this.executeStr = "Here are the list of tasks that matches the keyword:";
* @return A string containing all the saved tasks.
this.executeStr = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* @param lstNo The index of the task to mark.
* Returns a string to let user know that the selected task is marked.
* @return A string to let user know that the selected task is marked.
this.executeStr = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + this.taskList.getTask(i);
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Prints a string to let user know that the todo task has been added.
this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + todo + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + this.taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param lstNo The index of the task to unmark.
* Returns a string to let user know that the task has been unmarked.
* @return A string to let user know that the task has been unmarked.
this.executeStr = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + this.taskList.getTask(i);
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefWidth="400.0" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/17" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/17" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="ghbot.javafx.MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" />
<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" />
<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0">
Event event = new Event("house warming", "21 Jan 2023 1000AM", "21 Jan 2023 0600PM");
assertEquals("E | 0 | house warming | 21 Jan 2023 1000AM | 21 Jan 2023 0600PM", event.toFile());
Event event = new Event("house warming", "21 Jan 2023 1000AM", "21 Jan 2023 0600PM");
assertEquals("E | 1 | house warming | 21 Jan 2023 1000AM | 21 Jan 2023 0600PM", event.toFile());
Event event = new Event("house warming", "21 Jan 2023 1000AM", "21 Jan 2023 0600PM");
assertEquals("[E][ ] house warming (from: 21 Jan 2023 1000AM to: 21 Jan 2023 0600PM)", event.toString());
Event event = new Event("house warming", "21 Jan 2023 1000AM", "21 Jan 2023 0600PM");
assertEquals("[E][X] house warming (from: 21 Jan 2023 1000AM to: 21 Jan 2023 0600PM)", event.toString());
